Q0qwSgj60WwBwuRfWNIGyw.text: very traditionla English restaurant I was looking around the place with all the guys wearing suits ! I was the youngest there however, I enjoyed food, wine and service

mcT-8LsjIcWrz15dB6o03A.text: It may be the lunch shift, or the menu just being not my style (in general I find British food less than appealing), or the noise level - just didn't hit home for me.I'll be honest, I would happily do 3.5/3.75 stars, it is a good spot, and I would certainly return for a business meal. The service is quite good - very attentive without being intrusive. The service gets 4 stars really, and were no doubt stressed by the general holiday rush.The food is well executed and looked great, as one might expect, what troubled me is the dullness - everything tasted fine (if a bit under seasoned) but the menu just so "what to choose when these all seem so similar." It is likely a combination of my ignorance of traditional British cuisine and distaste for much of the same left me less than impressed.I suspect someone who better appreciates traditional British dishes would find the menu very pleasing. The local colleagues I was with were thoroughly satisfied. I appreciate that the execution was quite good, but the bland flavors just left me wanting more.Perfect for business lunches and dinners - everyone will be please, but few will be blown away.

8eCRBhA-BMq2vT7Twpyt_w.text: Had high expectations butleft disappointed.Room is so packed and hot that you feel uncomfortable. Also the food quality is average and completely overpriced  same for drinks.Will put this in the category been there, done that  but cannot recommend it at all  sorry folks.

65PMpVYpCc7ghwwsB1zrOQ.text: Bustling restaurant with food of the high quality you'd expect.The bar was a mob scene and we never got seated in the bar in spite of being on the waiting list for more than an hour.There are many British restaurants in London now and this ranks as one of the best.

yydkHQlgdsW-PnIbg5BT3g.text: Having been a regular in New York at the London Hotel outpost I've had a love hate relationship with Gordon (I was delivered $200 moldy chocolate covered strawberries from room service, and have yet to forgive him). THAT IS, until back to back sensational dining experiences at the Savoy Grill this WEEK! Service was flawless as were both cuts of beef. The first night a flavorful well seasoned, perfect temperature Rib Eye and for the second, what as a Yank, I call a perfect New York strip. The cocktails were great and sommeliers poured generous portions of wine by the glass as I went solo. The chefs went out of their way  allowing me to order the foi gras that was a special the first night and not on the menu the second. First time I've had it with a mushroom preparation. Superb! In short, the strawberry incident is forgiven and the crusty bugger that is Gordon Ramsey has redeemed himself in my eyes by delivering two exceptional, memorable meals during my stay. Kudos.

949EacB37IChwH0_wE1YQg.text: Extremely disappointed!!  We've always wanted to eat a Gordon Ramsey restaurant and looked forward to our meal!! We ordered the Beef Wellington, carrots and mushrooms; the Beef Wellington came to the table cold and mushy, the carrots were caramelized and did not taste like carrots at all they were to sweet, the mushroom were also mushy.  We cancelled dessert and decided to leave.  The service was excellent everyone extremely polite and attentive.  We've watched Gordon Ramsey on television for some time now and had high expectations of his place.  To say the least we were let down!

aQk9REyHT_MCmaHZZINUlw.text: I have vistied this restaurant three times over the past 4 years on each of my travels to London.  On this occasion we had, what has to be one of the worst meals in my life.  We ordered from the daily trolley spoecial, a pork rib - what I got was a raw piece of pork with more fat that meat.  i asked for it to be cooked further and it came back so tough I could not chew it.  The staff obliged and removed this meal from my guest and myself but the damage was done.  I have never eate raw pork before.  Anything they offerd afterwards was sub-par and I couldn't get the taste of that meal out of my mind. Of course we compained, expecially given the awards that Gordon Ramsey has received. The comment we got  was that this is a grill, not one of Gordon Ramsey Michelin star restaurants, thus what we got we should have expected.I will not be going back to the Savoy Grill in th future.  London has wonderful restaurants, even the main restaurant at the Savoy is 100% better than this.

T_5Zzd-h9XK6zCMVZL2FIg.text: I was here for a work thing last Wednesday, so I wasn't paying, but it was still disappointing. We had a small caulifour soup as the first course, this was really good, they could really have just served a bigger bowl of this and missed the next course. Then it was beef carpaccio. For some reason mine looked and tasted well done - which was weird for a carpaccio and didn't really work as it was too chewy and there was no sauce - but to be fair most other people's were bright red and clearly raw. Quite a lot of people still left theirs though, the general comment seemed to be that it was quite big chunks of raw meat, rather than delicate thin slices like it should be. The next course was halibut. This was a little bit rubbery, so I think it was a bit over-done. Finally we had rum baba. Pretty much no-one round the table finished this, which I think was down to a combination of wine consumption and the fact that it tasted a lot like sugar mixed with chemicals. And they nearly forgot my coffee.

68j9ceBckjCMf1vYkGFfOg.text: My boyfriend took me here just after Christmas, we had dinner before we went and saw a West End Show. I was very excited to eat at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants and I have to admit it definitely lived up to my expectations. I had soup for a starter and fish for the main course. The flavors were like nothing I have ever tried before. Unfortunately, I can't remember the exact names of the dishes I had but I would think that everything on the menu is delicious. The service was excellent and the bottle of Rose we ordered was superb.

WAkn6sGrvy_hP-tBeo_lPw.text: We had a superb meal on Monday evening. Interesting menu, some new dishes for me, and every item of the food was superb, as you would expect at any Gordon Ramsey restaurant. The bread was very poor though - rock hard and impossible to eat. Waiters and waitresses in abundance, and a bit over powering at times; they constantly top up water and Champagne (to get the second sale i suspect), even before you have taken a sip! Also not one was English and they were often difficult to understand. Also, the chips - despite what it says on the menu, they are NOT hand cut and were clearly frozen - i cant see how you run out of fresh potato on a Monday. But all other things were superb, and the food was not too expensive either. Great range of Champagnes, but silly prices. Restaurant manager (who is English) was superb though.

7fc_n-GayY_wt8d_JyJjxA.text: Went for lunch. The set lunch and a glass of decent wine is a good deal. You do have to order the veg in addition but they are well priced and you can share as the principle item on the dish is generous. Interesting good choice menu. 3 + 3 +2 choices. Starters were very good indeed, mains were less accomplished but still enjoyable, chips excellent and puds were great. Service was first class  attentive & interested. Recommended.

UDIbLfqehqrj47YZ7jlGSA.text: Went here for a business dinner while in London.  Excellent choice.  Very attentive service.  Food & wine were good as well.  I only wish we did not have to rush out and skip dessert.  Hope to be back again on my next trip to London.

zX_GKK6dqulDJ0D6Wgf5EQ.text: Just back from a wonderful lunch for my wife's birthday to top off a lovely morning at the National Portrait gallery.Started with a glass of bubbly and then wonderful starters, my wife's Omelette Arnold Bennett was fantastic and rich, I had a beautiful and simple smoked mackerel pate. We then moved on to Dover Sole (her) and Scallops with poached leeks in a shrimp juice (me), quite spectacular and great with jersey royals. The lady wife had a coffee and I had 'burnt English cream' (Creme Brulee to you and me).I booked on line and mentioned (in the box provided) that it was a lunch for my wife's birthday and with the coffee they brought out a slice of cake complete with candle.The room is wonderful and as we arrived early we got a booth facing the room so some great people watching. The clientèle is a great mix of old regulars, business men and youngsters out for a good time. It's very very special, not cheap but very very special.

731OAvOa_Qs5ynA6fCXGOQ.text: I was here with a largish group recently. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The food was great, the ambiance fine, and the service top notch. The Savoy Grill definitely goes on the "recommend to others" list.

iTNacfjkcyIdravc47eG9w.text: If you lack salt in your diet, this I the place to come. Snails were overcooked and way to salty, filet was flavourless (thank god they killed the bernaise with salt to five the steak some flavour) .  Gordon Ramsay time to come back and do a little of the screaming you are known for at this kitchen staff. Too much time in TV, not enough time looking after your kitchens (or your brand).

O1qHLJHyXlX3_bQg5zm6gA.text: Four of us went to dine at the Chef's table for a special celebration and had the time of our lives! The food is exceptional, to say the least. The kitchen staff became like family before the evening was over. Every course was presented by the cook who made it and all were very jovial, young, passionate and friendly. I may be mistaken in calling them cooks because it seemd like they were instrumental in the concept and creation. We got to prepare and cook our own steaks which were some of the best meat I've eaten anywhere, even in the wild west. The private dining room with one big table looks onto part of the kitchen through a big window. We could not hear anything from the kitchen but got to watch the intense activity involved with preparing dinner for a very large party upstairs. This in no way delayed our feast but we did witness the F bomb from the chef, which was hilarious, as was the staff reaction to it and their smiles and shrugs to us. All part of the Ramsay culture and why we were there. There were so many courses of great food we couldn't even touch the final presentation of chocolates. It was definitely a worthwhile experience.

oFpIVN4G5Q48Os-rijF4sA.text: I visited the Savoy in London many years ago and since then at destinations globally. My fiancé and I made a reservation at the Savoy Grill in London for 9.00pm on the 1st of September, under her name. My future parents-in-law flew over from Rome for their first trip to London and this was to be their first meal dining out since landing in the UK. As you can appreciate, meeting my fiancés parents for the first time is an exceptionally important event. Hence why I trusted the Savoy to deliver an excellent service, as has been present previously. Once arriving we were seated promptly, however, we were then informed that their was a problem with the oven/grill, rendering all items from the grill section redundant. For a place called the Savoy grill I consider this completely unacceptable, however the situation deteriorated further from there. They knew about the issue 2 hours before our arrival, and we were not informed, which I consider extremely rude considering they had all our contact details. We then ordered the lobster as an alternative and were again informed that they had run out of that as well. To compensate, the staff moved us to Simpsons (another restaurant in the Savoy) where we were told that there would be steak available. We were seated below the air conditioner (the table first on the left when entering) and asked for it to be turned down 3 times with no measurable change. So much so that I had to go to the cloak room and retrieve a jumper and jacket for my future parents-in-law so they were not too cold. I too went and got a jumper. We looked at the menu briefly and myself, her father and mother all ordered the rump steak. Two minutes later the waitress returned to inform us they were out of that here as well. I can't remember a time that I've received such bad customer service. I could probably have made a better first impression taking them to Nandos.

00B6byOGpnhukOb1S_2hhg.text: very nice food bit expensive but it is very nice and would highly recommend.

RD0hCP7nWstuaxAKfmoAIw.text: Food was mostly good. Steak was as expected, excellent while the mashed potatoes side dish were overly salted. An order of duck was decent while the side dish were dominated by the sausage in it. Pick out the sausages and it were excellent. Service: this is where they failed for me. Sommelier were indecisive and seemed reluctant to make any actual recommendations for wine with the duck. Our server at one point came over, looked at our duck plate and asked how the lamb was and gave no indication she realized she messed up before we pointed out it was in fact a duck. For the prize in such a place you expect service to be spotless.

FpSJ-9djRjMknINzywD5gA.text: From the doorman and the coat-check girls and every member of the wait staff, the service here is fantastic!Both our chateaux brieande and apple tart were plated at table-side (and both were perfect!)Every other place we've been has claimed to have "a bar" but this is the first we've been to in London where they would actually mix my wife a Mojito.  After she had hers, everybody at the next table ordered one!

aU9RyDHxpiOxKDN84NcD-Q.text: My friend and I had tickets for a ballet at the Royal Opera House and thought it would be a good occasion to discover the Savoy Grill food as they offered a pre-theatre menu. The food and the wine were excellent but the main waiter who looked after us was so pushy to take away our plates and make us order more food that it ruined the whole experience. We arrived at 5:30, time of the booking, and after being seated, the main waiter handed us normal menus so we told him that we wanted to try the pre-theatre menu and he replied by listing champagne/cocktail options although we already asked for water so he recommended still or sparkling water and when we replied that we just wanted tap water he looked annoyed and left. Then he came back with the pre-theatre menus and returned not even a full minute later to ask if we decided what we wanted. A couple of minutes later he came back and we made our picks and he tried to make us order a side dish and, again, looked annoyed when we said that we didn't want any. Then we had a break from this waiter for the duration of the starter and as a was finishing my main (the poached sea trout) I took a piece of bread to dip in the remaining mussel broth and as I put it in my mouth the waiter came and took away our plates. Then he came back with the desserts options, we said we were happy with the bill and he tried to push for tea or coffee and, again, looked annoyed that we didn't order any! I don't know if the management encourages or not the waiters to behave this way but it is absolutely unacceptable for a restaurant to use a pre-theatre menu as a bait and then make customers feel guilty if they don't order more food.

biGn5hPfe3E4SwmqXzyRCg.text: My girlfriend and I were here last summer and it was one of the best dinners we have had. We had the escargot and I had the meat pie and she had the salmon. We had just had a full tea at 5pm and we didn't think we could eat more but we went for our reservation at 7pm since it was our last day and I am glad we did. We just talked about it yesterday and said we could have paid double our tab and it would still have been worth it.

lRWoAK59fgC4azYGZ7LVpw.text: Excellent restaurant - would be five stars but the horrendously expensive tab gives pause ..I took a colleague and a client- starter soup was out of this world - the Dover sole main was also excellent- veggies superb , al dente - Service a tad on the slow side - but nothing dramatic. Finally - the room is one of the finest in the city - stunning   Worth a visit -start saving

CLFWoYG7W2iUinGQyX_4DQ.text: Very tasty!My husBAND is a huge Gordon Ramsay fan so we had to eat at one of his restaurants while in London...we chose Savoy Grill.  Savoy Grill is located in the super swanky Savoy Hotel.  The restaurant is equal in grandeur to the hotel.  Just simply gorgeous!!!  The service is top notch and the food was very tasty.  We started with the lobster bisque and tomato gazpacho, then moved onto the seabass with new mint potatoes and tomato and onion salad.  I have to say, we were not even remotely full at this point as the portions are kinda small.  So, we ordered dessert.  We got the chocolat marquis with ganache center and peppermint ice cream and chocolate profiteroles.  OMG...soooo good.  At this point, we were about to explode!!!We left so full and satisfied that we went back to our hotel and crawled into bed.  At 11 pm!!!  This is unheard of for me!!!I would definitely recommend a night at Savoy Grill if you are in the area!!!

yhaJADOGWXOlefgd6BICGw.text: For diners looking for an excellent taste of traditional British cuisine with 5 star service at a 4 star price the Savoy Grill's pre-theater dinner is the perfect match. We stopped in before going to see a nearby show. The staff were friendly and asked us for the timing of the musical to help us get there on time. The food was excellent, British and comfortable. I was impressed, especially given that most of the higher end restaurants in London stick to serving French or modernist cuisine. The Savoy hotel where the restaurant is located is lovely and the restaurant itself has a very romantic, if a but gaudy, atmosphere.

Fp1EbZbRPCv7Qj8193ryvw.text: Where is Gordon Ramsey when you need him! Ate here last year and had a better experience. We are staying here at Savoy for a month , so concierge made reservation for lunch. Kept waiting 15 minutes for a table when there were some ready. Waited another 15 minutes for sommelier to order wine. He recommended most expensive one on by the glass list. Bread cane. Must have been sliced early in day since was hard on surface. Sent back and came as should have in first place. My companion ordered off menu. Rabbit stuffed with mushrooms. Very nice although rabbit could have been cooked a little more. Had side salade to start that was supposed to have shallots, but instead had very strong , overwhelming onions. I had pre fix lunch. Started with carpaccio. First time I have ever had it with cooked beef. Could have ordered from deli ( rare roast beef sliced thin). Next was sea bream. Very strong flavor, with something resembling hush puppy. Best part of lunch was plum tart with clotted cream. Oriental waiter was pleasant but had no clue about food. Will try another place next time.

MY_iMxFebUNjOUuPPuUeQA.text: I am a fan of Chef Gordon Ramsay! I had the famous Beef Wellington from the trolley (on Wednesday). Absolutely delicious! It comes with red wine juice, horseradish sauce, and a side of seasonal garnish and roasted potatoes. Love it, love it, love it! :)  So happy! :) The Savoy Grill restaurant is pretty (glad I had a cute little dress). The staff is sweet and helpful.

fv7ure8W86dWnKAjTZS4jA.text: This place is only reserved for the elites.   If you look like a peasant, they'll treat you like one. First time to London and this place made me realize the mass disparity between the rich and the poor. I'm asian and right when i walked in, there were all eyes on me. Beginning with the host(girl) who asked me to take off a piece of clothing because it was their "policy". She then told her boss(girl) to come talk to me about my garment. I kindly said no, so she went to her boss (guy) to tell me off. After that, i just left. Leave me alone you asshats. Im here trying to eat dinner with my family and you had 3 people come up to me to bother me when the entire restaurant is dark asf. Nobody cares if I have a home ad garment on, only the staff. I left and went to flatiron carnaby to get my steak and not only was the steak well-priced but the service was impeccable. Was served by a younger crowd whom didn't judge you on what you wear or the color of your skin.

JxukIiX_DYb737Pf8bBMvw.text: Very bad service, food took literally 2 hours to get to us. The salad was a joke and after all that waiting the food came to us not like we asked. It's a shame because I was actually really excited to try the food here. Tbh I don't recommend you come here.

mYrnZ6jnuRRl70Q9n_0dWQ.text: One of the best meals I've ever had! Fantastic service, excellent upscale atmosphere, pricey but worth it. A wonderful place to come for a special meal while visiting London, and enjoy the history and decor of the Savoy Hotel. The Beef Wellington for two is a must-have. My friend and I had dessert, but were also served some odd petit fours at the end of our meal. Beautiful presentation, but they all tasted quite weird. Otherwise, we enjoyed a wonderful meal - definitely place I would recommend and come back to.

V-Nzm2opnRh7XCY_3u6p2w.text: WOMP. Disappointing. This was our big splurge meal in London and it was wayyyyy too rich for us. So maybe it's a preference thing? Beef Wellington is so heavy that I didn't want an appetizer because they had already given us bread and we ordered two sides with our main dish. But our server was super pushy and we kind of felt forced (and judged) into getting one. When she offered the tasting menu I replied, "No thank you I don't eat seafood" and she was not happy about that. Like lady, clearly you want us to buy the expensive wine pairing with tasting menu but I DON'T EAT SEAFOOD which are 4 of your courses. Then again with the appetizer "they're small you should get two" Yeah...then I won't eat my actual dinner. Ambience nice, and they were super attentive with refills. But the food wasn't worth it and our server was way too aggressive with the upselling. The crepe for dessert is delicious though! Much lighter than I thought it was going to be and actually a nice balance to our super heavy food.

mLrFpCvL0-gcFersKJbFCQ.text: Simply Orgasmic! This is an amazing restaurant! Perfect for a treat! They pull out your chair and bring Welsh still water and what other drinks you ordered immediately. They come promptly with a variety of quality breads and butter and to take your wine order (Even the cheapest ones were the very smooth and well-aged). We had the Game Menu, which started with a wonderfully light smoked duck borscht consommé. After a bit of time to digest the food and talk...the wood pigeon with pickled walnut pastry and smoked bone marrow came. This course was cooked perfectly offering a simple combination that was flavorful. The main course roe deer was cooked to a sublime medium rare and served with soft apples and a Gin Juniper Gravy. Best venison that I've ever had! We finished off with poached pears, an anise biscuit and a vanilla bean ice cream drizzled in a thick fudge sauce. We were then offered a whiskey and brandy cart and Americano coffees which included neutralizing lemon tarts and chocolates. This place isn't cheap, but worth it for a nice supper. You get what you pay for! If you do it do it right!

iUcQRJbsjviRQVUhTMna_Q.text: Delicious, but DON'T go for pre-theatre dining!!The website states that reservations prior to 7pm are limited to 90 minutes, and so we got a 5:30 reservation prior to a 7:30 show that was a 10-15min walk away. But that isn't at all how it went down.The meal started nicely and attentively. The Arnold Bennett omelet was warm but not hot, but the entrees were delicious. However, we started to notice the time was running short, and at 7pm (when we had planned on leaving) we had to ask for the dessert (that came with the prix fixe menu) to be served along with the check. We didn't see anyone again until 7:20 when I finally had to ask for the check without having the dessert we paid for, because our show was about to start. By the time our card was run we had to hustle to Cambridge Theatre and we missed the first 10 minutes of the show - we were lucky to be let in!I was disappointed because I expected 4 or 5 star service from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and he clearly doesn't spend as much time on his actual restaurants as he does on his Hell's Kitchen ones.

cSMA6mMLd7HCv-yX0Fguhw.text: I must say.. If my review was based and staff and service. This would be 5 stars. They could not have been more on the money.....as for the food. I actually thought it was quite average. Was neither impressed or not impressed... I do not think it was over priced. From staff.. From checking in, coat service waiters etc... Spot on... Food.. I wanted to try other things... Sadly, and I'm not basing the review on this. I wanted to try Gordon's famous items. Unfortunately they were for two people and I was alone. That's fine, so I went with the Theater menu... I won't be exact, in fairness.. Because I forget exactly.. I started with the Hen egg mushroom starter. I don't like mushrooms.. So I removed them... I really enjoyed it, but I didn't think it was anything to special. Then I had the Artichoke Risotto Parmesan. Another... It was actually really good, a little to salty for me... But I don't use much salt. Then I had the cheese plater for desert... I'm certain I have this wrong.. But it was just a large serving of like blu cheese, Brie and cheddar or something. Disappointed... Presented nicely... But I would have preferred a couple smaller portions of better cheeses. It said assortant of British cheese.. Thought it would be different. To me.. 3 stars, is not bad. It is what it is. Great service, okay price, average food. I was a little disappointed.

ImKzK0SfMeN-FpQoo_AAjA.text: Lobster bisque was bitter with grains of sands in it.  The chateaubriand was dry and tasteless.  Sommelier recommended a bottle of 2009 wine, but brought back a bottle of 2012 and almost opened it without informing us.  I wonder if Gordon Ramsey knows what's going on in his restaurants, or he is too busy on TV?

wdc2OcUCStKALozIWFRyAw.text: While the wine was nice and the staff friendly, the overall preparation of the food left some to be desired. Both the seafood bisque and the ribeye steak we received had far too much salt and made eating difficult.

lXQ0UrrmC77qHB2zp5jAOg.text: Best in Town!! Quite expensive but high Quality!Delicious.

OgibVacltr9LTvG7HGX96w.text: Very special decor: art deco dark wood contrasted with chrome/silver hardware.  Most tables are booths which is a big win in my book.  The Sirloin was excellent! Very flavorful, thick "inch-and-a-half" cut peice of meat.  They actually performed a perfect medium rare, something "rare" in London... red inside with a nice caramalized exterior. Dover Sole was de-boned table-side.  All in all, and impressive experience.p.s. after dinner visit the piano lounge or the american bar in the hotel.

q-VYJdYNFChgI3DXIPDxPQ.text: The Savoy Grill is Chef Gordon Ramsay's classic British and French restaurant located in the gorgeous Savoy Hotel. The entire staff was very kind and friendly. I tried the "Taste of Savoy Grill" which is a seven-course sampling menu designed by Head Chef Kim Woodard. The Lobster and Cornish crab bisque with brandy butter was delicious. The Glazed Omelette Arnold Bennett was rich, decadent, and exceptional!!! (I could feel the LDL rising-but it is okay!)  I was not very impressed with the seared scallops with charred sweet corn, beans, and air-dried ham. It reminded me of a chef-inspired dish served on an airplane. I substituted the Fish of the Day for the Beef Wellington and other red meat options.  The salmon was a major disappointment.  You can find better prepared salmon at almost any gastropub. The selection of French and British cheeses were delightful. The lemon posset and a fresh blueberry (A blueberry was substituted by the kitchen instead of fresh raspberries) was a nice palate cleanser. Finally, the strawberry, basil, lime zest, and balsamic crêpe Suzette flambéed at the table was a pleasant and fun surprise from a traditional crêpe Suzette.  My dining neighbors ordered and split the Baked Alaska which they loved. I enjoyed my sweet gifts in a to-go box. The restaurant was very cold due to the air conditioning. The lady seated next to me mentioned it to several staff members several times.  I reached a point of discomfort also.  The freezing blowing air killed the ambiance and I really wanted to leave. I felt the timing was off in the continuity and delivery of the meal service. I ordered this sampling menu to get the 'entire experience.' I appreciated the choices, the progression of flavors, temperatures, and textures but it was too much food.  I would have preferred the a la Carte menu in hindsight.  This restaurant has seated many famous guests. I have eaten at other Michelin-star restaurants.  I was disappointed in that I did not feel the innovation, creativity, preparation, presentation, and delivery of this meal was at an equivalent level of other Michelin-star restaurants.  The prices, however, exceeded other Michelin-star restaurants that I have experienced (and reviewed.) I realize my expectations were high but this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.... fairmont.com and gordonramsayrestaurants.…

Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom

Mqcdqyv3pKkgfjL2ehbRTQ.text: We came here a couple of weeks ago and were seated next to Tom Jones!Anyway.. about the dinner!The food here is absolutely delicious. To start with my husband and I shared the foie gras and escargot. The foie gras was very flavourful and creamy, but what really stood out for me was the escargot. The flavours were exceptional; every mouthful was a savoury delight. For the main dish I enjoyed the dover sole which was cooked superbly. They de-bone the fish at the table which was impressive. My husband greatly enjoyed his rib-eye steak too. On a previous occasion I have ordered the fillet steak, which was also fantastic. The stand out side dish for me was the cauliflower cheese.  We happened to be having a late anniversary celebration, so we were very impressed when  they brought out a variety of several small cakes to finish. Yum!For me, the restaurant loses one star as I enjoy a little more creativity on the menu than what is offered at the Savoy Grill. I also feel that although the service was very attentive, the servers were a little cold towards us. It has to be said that Gordon Ramsey does a fantastic job at maintaining such high standards of cooking at this restaurant. It really is a treat to come here for a special meal!

1e2g6ks9V1X0vofTfZC6Cw.text: This London landmark is exactly what you would expect it to be- expensive, quite formal and delicious. Got a same day reservation when our original dinner plans had to be cancelled- this somewhat surprised me (it was very busy while we were there). Very formal service that was absolutely perfect at all stages. A bottle of mineral water & a bottle of French Chateau Lagarde (pretty much the only wine on the list we could reasonably afford- but it was delicious!). Started with seared foie gras for myself & lobster bisque for my wife- both marvellous. Wife had a perfect rib eye, while I had the delicious, deboned-table side Dover sole meunière. We shared sides of frites & creamed spinach. Total with optional service charge (tip) and £2/each cover charge (?really?) was an astounding £231, but it was worth it to us for the incredibly good food and he whole experience. Unless I won the lottery, I doubt we'd ever be able to justify eating here on a subsequent trip to London!

0MSVbEBf9lhuLwWp0BbFiA.text: What a disappointment. We were staying at the Savoy and had fond memories of past visits to the Grill, but this was less than impressive. We were entertaining long time friends and celebrating my husband's birthday so we were hoping for a special evening. Nothing special here. Slow dispassionate service. Mediocre courses. Even the acclaimed steaks were tough and not worthy of the flashy table side presentation of raw cuts and high prices. And the service was so lacking. We had to keep asking for water. Empty plates sat for unacceptably long periods of time in front of us and not a smile from anyone on the staff. Certainly not good value for money in a town with so many exceptional choices. We wont be coming back to the Grill which does not match the marvelous standards of the Hotel.

Otp_U4Nk55cQcs4HLgyahw.text: Yelp comes through again...Gordon Ramsey style. I was tasked with finding a suitable dinner location (that took reservations) and could get us swiftly on our way to a show at the Noel Coward Theater by 730pm. A quick Yelp search  led me to The Savoy Grill, an upscale eatery within a beautiful hotel that had a history of getting theater patrons off to their shows on time. Done and done, reservation easily booked, and we were in business. We arrived promptly at 530, enjoyed a beautiful meal and arrived to our show with time to spare, easily catching a quick taxi from the hotel. Couldn't have been easier. The food was absolutely lovely -- a refined British menu. Simple, yet fancy. Well priced for the area (ignore the price rating -- it's truly not so pricey for London). I enjoyed the ham and chicken pie with a decadent cream sauce, mashed potatoes and a few chips I stole from my husband. The table also enjoyed a New York strip, halibut and the lamb roll. There was not one bit of descent from the crowd. Everyone was happily satisfied and stuffed. The service was excellent from start to finish. Welcoming, friendly, knowledgeable. Quick with drinks, wine and the food, which was important as we were on a timed schedule. Though they never made it feel rushed. It's got the old school charm of a classy restaurant -- without being stuffy. The crowd was mixed with hotel guests, theater goers, some tourists, young, old. The menu will surely strike just about anyone's fancy -- perhaps, maybe not vegetarians, but I'm sure there were even a few things for them. Would surely return. My first Gordon Ramsey restaurant -- and I have to say, it lives up to the legend. Headed to a show? This is your spot for a nice dinner beforehand. Thank me later and send me some chicken pie!

4FGEfax6UJ59Ht9NGq7h-A.text: Always been amazing when visited! I always have to get the creamed sautéed spinach which is a big must! Service is 5 stars without a shadow of a doubt. Wonderful atmosphere and although the size is large and get busy, you still feel like you have your private space with the big chairs. Price point is great for everything you get. It's a wonderful place, and an amazing experience. I do this annually.

XI5KUCQ6yyA-9Xl8jCQgVw.text: We were incredibly disappointed. Dinner took 3 hours for starters. The beef wellington was highly recommended by the Savoy Hotel staff where the restaurant is located. After waiting almost 2 hours to be served our entrees it was cold and really not that great. This restaurant is over priced and just worth the money.  After asking several times where our food was they started offer my wife more free food she didn't want.  Not a good experience and actually bad enough for me to write a review.

Cdl0DUAx6ZPE3oxrVT_HwA.text: this was a very special birthday dinner for me and our last night in London.  we had planned ahead and made reservations 3 months in advance.  they were totally booked .. as they are every night.their service redefines perfection!  the food was absolutely amazing, delicious, great portions with an amazing presentation style.  here in the US we have several of the Gordon Ramsay TV shows on and we watch them all.  we now totally understand what he and his team strive for - very much appreciated, one of the best meals and experience of my life.  Thank you to all that helped make this the best meal we have ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. very sweet gesture
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Chateaubriand steak
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. escargot

T565Eh30zbeAn6ohC-8vwQ.text: I was looking so forward to having a meal at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants.  I guess all that anticipation led to a bit of overhype for me.  My thoughts and expectations of what the meal would be was much higher than the actual meal was.  From a value standpoint, I have to say the name has given the establishment prices that are absurdly high.  I honestly could have passed on the whole thing.Dinner there started with the farmhouse terrine.  I got sucked into it as an appetizer because of the foie gras parfait that was served along side it. It was a solid dish.  The meat was succulent and you get the decadence that is added by the foie gras.    The green tomato chutney adds a bit of acid to bring everything together and brighten up everything.  The dim lighting of the restaurant kind of obscures the ability to see the elegant plating of the dish.I think my fault came in when it came to the entree selection.  I think I would have been much better off if if I went with one of the many selections from the "Roasts, Braises and Pies" section of the menu.  Don't get me wrong my Rib Eye steak was pretty good.  Cooked to the perfect temperature and was very juicy and didn't need much of the sauce.  However when I look at the menu and I compare that steak at £34 to a lamb wellington at £26, I kind of feel like an idiot for my selection.  You do get a nice flavor from the wood grill, but that particular steak was slightly overpriced in my opinion.Though I was ready to burst by this point I still decided to try out dessert, I went for the raspberry souffle.  About as light delicate and perfect as anything in I can remember, I suddenly felt betrayed by my stomach's inability to finish consuming it.  It was a really good dessert non the less.

rgA-9bPQva1GB1mxxNixQQ.text: Excellent service and staff went out of their way to be of assistance.  Great choices on the menu and exquisite interior design.  Well worth the visit and a meal

lTtrLpZZjJRoV9KDWNP1bw.text: came here after the Theatre for dinner on a recommendation it lived up to its reputation. We were very impressed for the most part! I especially liked the cheese selection that was part of our 5 course meal. I did not find the lobster bisque to be very good and I have had that everywhere I travel. Overall this was a good choice.

U2UfQTuc082iO4K2zWY7Nw.text: Gordon Ramsay has it all figured out.... English Asparagus appetizer was amazing and then out came the ribeye...one of the best I've had, my 10 & 12 yr old daughters shared the Beef Wellington and being fans of Gordon, have looked forward to tonight for such a long time and were blown away by it..cherries jubilee prepared table side was incredible...the waitstaff were all very friendly and knowledgeable and since my girls were talking up how amazing dinner was and how great the chef had done, they invited them back into the kitchen and took pics with the chefs....a night they both will never forget....thank you Savoy Grill!

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Ribeye!!!
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington....

f0X90gQKBqK0SI2qtd_bPA.text: I was expecting so much more given the high standards Gordon Ramsay expects from contestants on Hell's Kitchen and Master Chef. Sadly I did not feel that level of standard was met at Savoy Grill.My wife and I ordered the Scallop and Beef Wellington.Scallop was not seared at all, they put green tasteless crust on top.  The scallop was not very good and we did not eat half of the plate. The service was on point and they asked us if everything was okay with the Scallop dish.  They offered to not charge us for the dish or replace with another entrée but we were already full and felt uneasy asking to take the charge off our bill so we didn't complain.Beef Wellington was the reason we came to this restaurant but it did not deliver. To be fair I've never had Beef Wellington but we do frequently eat at high end restaurants and we often make Prime Grade steaks at home. The dish was luke warm when served and the taste did not impress us. For what we paid, I would rather have a Waygu/Kobe filet at a nice steakhouse.

QijIL6Ft_XYn0uB7eThzmw.text: I've been looking forward visiting this Gordon Ramsey restaurant in London for years. And tonight here I am, all dressed up and ready for the experience. Interestingly enough, I was underwhelmed. First off, kudos to the entire staff: Attentive, friendly, professional and eager to please. Top notch and excellent service! The main dinning room was smaller than expected. The ambience was a little lacking. Maybe some music in the background would help? We were introduced to a cart of cold Champagne right away (Yes Please!). Didn't care much for the escargot snail, which was blend and Unflavorful. My main entrée, the scallops dish with pea green sauce was tasty. However, the three scallops were small bite size. That was another appetizer, right?? I indulged in my wife's Beef Wellington, which was cooked and sliced perfectly. The sides of mushrooms, mash potatoes and spinach were small and under seasoned. The dishes were two dimensional and appear to be missing additional ingredients and seasoning. The baked Alaskan passion fruit space was however heaven with very fresh ingredients. The food was overly good, but was lacking the Waw factor. Oh well, been there, done that. Next...

ZRjtfdwMQ11SZ0fIRaP_bQ.text: I ordered off the theater menu and must say I was disappointed. I had the meat pie and figured it would be the best place to try such a dish since I'm from out of the country. I wish I would have order the Wellington instead. The service on the other had was amazing! Loved our waiter. He made the experience for me.

4xxXQaQPeyIvJ7ma7-mx0w.text: There is a lot that is good to say about the Savoy Grill - the service for one, the surroundings for another. As a large group (hen do but, you know, the tamer kind) sitting down for the set lunch the service was amazing - water kept topped up, food all brought over at the same time and all of this with efficiency and friendliness.The surroundings were pretty amazing too. You're in the Savoy so wouldn't expect much less but it's still pretty astounding.The food itself was good - tiny portions as to be expected with a dessert of profiteroles the standout (though too rich for some of the party). We should have got some sides to split between the table - for your £30 you still need to add sides to your main. This wasn't a huge problem but it did feel a bit of a sting when the cheapest bottle of wine is also £30. But then again, no one expects a cheap lunch at the Savoy.There was usual large group quibble over the bill at the end - once again, proving an optional service charge is never really optional in these places. But service was so good there weren't any complaints.For a fancy, occasion lunch this really ticked the boxes.

J66Jiz2shHdzd1Mg78veEA.text: Very very very disappointed with my experience at the Grill.Although the food was to be expected, the experience was horrible. The air conditioning was too high. After numerous complaints to the staff and management, nothing was done. I was shivering as a result. The food got cold very quickly. When you pay the price the Savoy wants, freezing conditions, cold food and a poor manageress (who stayed silent when I complained to her, waiting for me to find a resolution) is not acceptable in any way.The ONLY reason that the Savoy has two stars is because of the food and the food alone. Despite the fact that he soufflé had coco pounder around the rim, which tasted bitter, the lobster bisque was very enjoyable, albeit very cold.My steak was over cooked and became rather dry as a result of this (medium rare came out as medium).Overall, this was a huge letdown and a major disappointment. Let's hope they get the heating right in the summer.NB: bring a winter coat to survive the air conditioning and a stern voice to deal with the manageress.Enjoy

UubAg9Xwoic8d0PTB_Nm9A.text: This was my second experience as an American Tourist at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant in London.  I admit that it lived up to my expectations.  It is located in the Savoy hotel, and definitely appears upscale, but I admit that not all of the gentlemen customers were wearing suits and ties - they cater to the theatre crowd as well.  Nice selection of wines.  Appetizers were interesting.  The omelette Arnold Bennett was amazing.  We could have eaten it alone and left happy.  This is a grill, and will grill several cuts of meat for you, cost based upon weight.  We did not partake of this offer, but it looked good if you were interested in steak alone.  The beef wellington was impeccable, done to perfection.  Although the diver scallops were not numerous, they were flavorful.  The dessert selection was a bit limited but good.  I would recommend this for all Gordon Ramsay fans touring in London.

nWZJJKvBE1NCfx0zEMImCw.text: Thought this place would be a bit too posh for me, but it's nowhere near as stuffy as I thought it would be. The waiter was polite but also a little bit of a cheeky chappy (in a very nice way), the food was excellent and plentiful, and we were very well looked after. Highly recommend the roast chicken for two, which takes a while to come out but it's worth the wait...just don't fill up on bread beforehand, as you'll need the extra room!

sULdXjO92zxLKga4LXCkhQ.text: We celebrated my wife's birthday, and enjoyed an awesome evening at Gordon Ramsay's Savoy Grill --  an iconic London landmark restaurant, dripping with history.  The Savoy Grill is a "go to", destination spot - and an outstanding dining experience.  From start to finish, service is impeccable, but not overly formal.  Art -deco inspired, the SG exudes old world charm, in an upscale and intimate setting.  Food was amazing.  For appetizers, I started with lobster bisque, which was finished with brandy butter, while my wife had the artichokes with pickled beetroot, and goat cheese -   both were expertly prepared.  For dinner -we decided on the Beef Wellington for two - a Gordon Ramsey specialty (at SG, and HK!).  It was beyond spectacular. Richly presented, perfectly cooked, with a flaky crust. Sides of mashed potatoes, and English peas with bacon lardons, and confit shallot were the perfect complement to our meal.A surprise dessert treat from the staff, and drinks taken care of, from a special friend - capped off an awesome evening.The Savoy Grill is no doubt expensive, but worth every penny!

3AxNYvhqyKZvf8c92F7KWA.text: Great desserts!  Nice and attentive staff, too.Dinner? I'll pass next time around. I enjoyed the lobster bisque, that's it.  I'm not sure if the steak can command such a price. Too much garlic and onion for my taste.  My friend enjoyed her wellington though.I'm glad I got to try it, but I probably won't be back

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Lemon curd cake

qRRvUEW9HDUXoRylr_GXoQ.text: I'm just going to cut straight to the point: overall a good experience but I was completely underwhelmed by the service my husband and I were given, considering we came prepared to drop some serious money on dinner and drinks.First off, I'd made reservations months previous and, recalling correctly, was asked upon booking the table on choosing either a la carte items or opting for a tasting menu instead. I remember selecting the tasting menu but, when we were seated, we were quickly offered only the a la carte menu...? Not a big deal, just something I was a bit confused about but, as we were only there for the beef wellington anyway, it worked out just fine.We ordered to start the steak tartare to share and a seafood cocktail for each, as we were pretty hungry and were told the beef wellington could take upto 45mins to perfect. The seafood cocktail was a surprising hit, served prettily in a martini glass with generous amounts of prawn and crab, dressed with the perfect amount of dressing. I was, at first, afraid of the amount of dressing (it didn't come tossed) but, after a quick taste, the dressing was delicate and light and coated everything perfectly.The tartare, though...I was blown away. I've had plenty of tartare before (steak, veal, bison, tuna, koi soi) but this one was up there with the best. Silky and tender, meaty and salted just the right amount, flavor that spread like butter over the grilled toast along with the egg yolk...I enjoyed this dish the most.The beef wellington came out quickly, much sooner than 45mins, I believe, although I wasn't timing anything. It was a delicate and juicy medium rare, sliced in two perfect medallions with a golden, crisp crust. I was already quite full by the time the beef arrived but certainly enjoyed the spread before me. The beef was plated before us, too, along side a head of roasted garlic and some spring greens.Service was wonderful in the beginning, but then lagged heavily. It was as if they forgot my husband and I were even seated. Water wasn't offered, dessert wasn't offered, other refreshments weren't offered, even our bill wasn't offered...The gentleman seated in the booth beside us enjoyed a meal and drinks and was half way out of the booth before I snagged a passing busboy for some additional refreshments. And it was odd, for we had 293847928374 people servicing us and all of 'em didn't seem to acknowledge us. :(It was fine, though. They did, before long, remember we were there and we were given all the goodies of dessert (we opted for light crepe and mulled berries with ginger ice cream) and espresso to top of our evening.Beautiful hotel, just beautiful. Gorgeous decor, plush seating areas, large, fragrant flowers and immaculate marble tiles...I fell in love with the atmosphere the hotel created, and along with it the history.All in all, I'd give the Savoy Grill another several visits, if given the chance.
