Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Seafood cocktail (prawn, crab, slaw, dressing)
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington (medium rare)

ZuXYyqktHutri-Zjm9zoVA.text: Had a lovely family lunch here during the Christmas period.  Food was good but service was really top-notch. Professional yet friendly. The atmosphere was jolly. I always have the Beef Wellington and I'm always slightly underwhelmed.  The pastry always seems soggy to me but the rest of my party thoroughly enjoyed it. Crepe Suzette were absolutely delicious. I acknowledge the food is probably a 3 1/2-4 but overall the place is a solid 4.

BCQvTexwke_zEIje9XSRyA.text: A good experience, but I was honestly expecting a bit more, given the reputation of the Savoy Grill as well as the affiliation with the infamous Gordon Ramsay.Stunningly beautiful, a night at the Savoy Grill is like stepping back in time to 1935. While they don't seem to enforce much of a dress code anymore, I would suggest dressing smart to befit the swanky dining room. Dark jeans might be okay, but I wouldn't go any more casual than that.The service was very friendly, but the dining room staff were not as attentive as they could be. We frequently had to refill our own water, and our mains took an inordinate amount of time to arrive given that tables who arrived after us got their food far earlier than we did. The waitstaff didn't seem very polished for such a fine establishment.Food wise, I must say I didn't love the escargot. Perhaps this was a British preparation that I wasn't familiar with, but I much prefer the French style with lots of garlic and olive oil. These snails seemed dry and were served in an odd red wine paste that didn't do much for me. The beef wellington, however, was truly excellent and one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Dover sole was well-prepared and perfectly de-boned upon request. The sides were very nice but very traditional in nature (think truffle mash, sauteed cauliflower, etc.).I was let down by the dessert menu, which ranged from boring (ice cream) to odd (lime, peanut, and banana baked Alaska). Seeing nothing appealing, I turned down dessert, which I think last happened in 2003.Prices weren't too outrageous for central London, and there's a pre-theatre menu that's a very good deal.

uxiQ9ezYsDwuc1MF66mqWw.text: We wanted to go to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant for my son's birthday and it did not disappoint. The service was good as the waitress was attentive. Food was excellent - the beef tartare was the best I have had. It had a sweet taste, different from others. The fillets and beef Wellington were excellent. One minor thing is that the atmosphere is a bit rigid/tight , but it did not takeaway from our time out. I recommend savoy grill to anyone looking for a nice and elegant evening out.

GVmMlSufnGQ94DX4Gj00RA.text: We went there to eat the famous Beef Wellington by Gordon Ramsay. The beef Wellington was amazing but the star of the night were the snails with garlic sauce. Simply delicious. We were really impressed. The service was perfect, we had 3 waiters serving us. Really personalized. Although it can get a bit too much as they interrupt you every 5 minutes. But apart from that 5 stars!

LIa3JS98UY_tTRU_ar4HMQ.text: Hmmm....There's a lot to like about Savoy Grille.  It's a beautiful space.  The food is often excellent.  The service is often spirited, human, and wonderful.I would recommend the Beef Wellington.  It was perfect.I would recommend the foie gras and chicken liver pate.  It was sublime in it's complexity and texture.  The flavor jumped onto the tongue.I would recommend the mushrooms as a side.  They were like no mushrooms I have had before.  Full and meaty, yet cooked through and with a flavor profile that developed throughout each bite.I would recommend the sommelier in particular.  So very friendly and approachable.  So very knowledgable about how to pair wine with food.  Wow.I wish I could end there.  I really do, because there are people who are skilled and try very hard at Savoy Grill.But then there was the waiter who gave us the "Is that all you're ordering?" tone, when we didn't order the 3" thick T-bone.  There was the rib eye, ordered medium rare, but which arrived rare at best to the table, and the same waiter who looked at me and said, "What do you want me to do about it?"There were the crepes suzette, which that same waiter managed to drown in hot butter, turning a delicate combination of orange perfumed chocolate gelato on top of the crepes...into an immediate pathetic mush of sloppy dough and melted ice cream.  The service is the final mile.  In an establishment such as Savoy Grill, in which so much of the food is prepared at table side, personnel problems such as I found at Savoy Grill make the difference between a fabulous evening and a "poor value for money" thought.  If you could do take out at Savoy Grill, you might be better guaranteed a good experience.  As is, examine your waiter.  If you get the same bald guy with the French accent we had, you might be better off elsewhere.

STq8dz6-avE2dBDjtSJ03w.text: I decided to give the Savoy Grill another chance - The food was awful on my last visit.  This time we ordered the beef Wellington which was good but not fantastic - a little dry and tough.  The truffle mashed potatoes & carrots were good too.  The place is beautiful & service was impeccable.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Lobster bisque
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Truffle mashed potatoes and carrots
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington

-cB2CHmLD3k-NmZ4s3olyQ.text: Hubby and I are huge fans of the tv show MasterChef where Gordon Ramsey is a judge and he often references his beef Wellington. We couldn't pass up the chance to try it when we recently visited London.Serendipitously we were already onsite (this restaurant is located inside The Savoy Hotel) because we had come for cocktails at the famous American Bar. When we realized this Ramsey restaurant was here while chatting with the bartender, hubby went and thankfully secured a reservation.We were tipsy from cocktails at American Bar when we arrived for our late dinner (10:45pm seating) and didn't mess around with looking at the menu. We went straight for the Wellington and some cocktails that were actually made table side!! How cool is that?! They literally wheel out a trolley and make cocktails on the spot. Sure, I've had guacamole, salad, dessert made table side but never cocktails. The cocktails were fantastic! I'll have to update the post once I recall their names.Our Wellington took about 20 minutes and we started out with French onion soup and cauliflower gratin. Both were to die for. The soup was perfectly seasoned and the gratin was cheesy creamy heaven. The Wellington was definitely the showstopper. Perfectly cooked and wrapped steak in mushroom pate and pastry. Beautiful and delicious! And served with a head of roasted garlic on the side!! Highly recommend you dine here, and the Wellington is a bit higher prices than everything else but worth it if you've never tried it and are Ramsey geeks like us.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Wellington + cauliflower gratin
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington!
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. French onion soup

ISDSEHUj1RSQFDPN0Ai8-A.text: We came here back in March due to it being conveniently on our hotel, but were disappointed. The service was good but the food was not great and not memorable at all. Liked Gordon Ramsay's other establishment more.

67tpG-vCI8DUSyRcvEP6tw.text: Came here for a special anniversary and my expectations were met. Servers were so attentive and funny. Dinner was delicious. The ambiance was busy yet the intimate setting was maintained. We were given a happy anniversary dessert which was a nice surprise.Beef Wellington and cheesy cauliflower were yum. Definitely enough for 2 ppl.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom

RUk5S1-byGQdH5xR_3fCqw.text: I have been a Gordon Ramsay fan for a while and when I found out I was going to his restaurant I was super excited. I ordered the taste of Savoy which came with 7 courses made to be slightly smaller than if they were ordered singular.  The lobster bisque was outstanding with flavors of fresh lobster all throughout the soup. I had a nice and juicy piece of lobster tail on the bottom. The omelette had fish,cream, eggs, and was very tasty but heavy. The scallops was delicious and so was the chicken wing but I am not a big fan of cauliflower so I didn't like that part. It was served and a scallop shell over sea salt. I had the Beef Wellington cooked Medium-rare and it was nice but was very flavorful due to it being filet mignon which is very lean. There was a cheese selection which was delicious. I over the  Yorkshire blue cheese. There was a mandarin posset with a blackberry sauce which was nice and creamy but just not to my tasting. To end the meal there was a delicious o  and basil crepe which came with chocolate orange ice cream. It was £98 for the tasting and I can't have wine due to being underage. I was very fortunate to have kitchen tour and meet all the chefs. We were all treaty with the utmost care and overall it was a amazing meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom

A1rb1_CvlhX4g87uGBc1_A.text: Amazing food and amazing service. Camelia and Valentina are amazing.The beef wellington is a world class dish that you must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom

FxOj6fErTIgfLwH9yYfFxQ.text: The prestige Savoy lived up to its reputation. My foodie companion and I ordered the prawns, lobster bisque, rump steak, and honey glazed ham. It was a very hardy meal walked off in our 7 mile stroll through the town. There are many gluten free options and if it is not they are willing to accommodate if possible. It was a great solid meal.

h-I-cVCEoqDegAGgjtXTEg.text: I really, really wanted to love this place, but sadly it was a let down.  I have always wanted to try Gordon's Beef Wellington and figured what better place than one of his restaurants in London.We got the tasting menu so we could try a few other items as well as the anticipated Wellington.  First course was Lobster and Cornish crab bisque.  The bowl came with a small piece of crab and lobster and they added the bisque at the table.  I was warned that it was really hot.  I gave it a few stirs and pulled out the lobster to give it a nibble.  To my surprise, it was cold and salty... (Could it be that they use frozen crab and lobster in the soup???).  I put the rest of the lobster back in and let it sit for a while to warm up with the bisque.  Overall, not good, not bad... Just OK.Second course was glazed omelet Arnold Bennett.  A very rich dish to follow a bisque.  I would have preferred a pallet cleanser between these two, but the dish was really good.  If this were on their menu as an appetizer, it is something I would order again.  Scotch is a sipping drink, not a shot...  Waitress, do not take my 20+ year Scotch!Third dish was scallop...  Seared scallop... But the were only half seared!  Instead of searing one side, they put a green tasteless chip on top.  If you take the green chip off, the scallop was OK, but would have moved up to good if it was just seared on both sides.No, I am not done with my Scotch!  Do not touch!!!Fourth dish was BEEF WELLINGTON!!!! The dish I have been waiting for!!! Something I can mark off my bucket list... Gordon Ramsay's signature dish!!!  After taking my first bite, I was expecting my taste buds to be in heaven... Only to be disappointed with yet another dish.  Not great, not good... Just okay.   I have had better from a small hole in the wall in the San Fernando valley for a quarter of the price.   I may be forced to chop off the waitresses hand if she tries to take my Scotch again!Fifth dish is cheese... DeliciousSixth dish was lemon posset with raspberries.  This was a very refreshing and delicious dessert.  Seventh dish was a strawberry crepes.  Awesome to watch them make and flambé, but they were just okay.  They were kind enough to add on an additional dessert as a special congratulations to us.  This was very kind, but to be honest, it was just another let down.  If it were something tasty it would have been greatly appreciated, but it was a dry cupcake with some chocolate frosting.  Would have preferred a glass of champagne or a hearty handshake.

gFzrzX6sTQwf1PEZk5stLQ.text: Went last night with friends for dinner. The place is small but very nicely decorated.  We were seated pretty quickly in a booth that was spacious and cosey.  We were pleased that they took our drink orders right away but 3 hours later we were waiting for our desert.  We were all laughing because our waitress would come over and ask if all was okay and before we could even ask for bread or water she would be gone.  Why bother asking?  After waiting over an hour for a main course the food was very disappointing.  I ordered the shrimp with linguini and it had no flavor at all.  I barely ate it.  We had to ask to have the dirty glasses removed from our table and was told they were short a bus boy.  They are short allot of workers.  Would not go back

5_HzO08t_eAt3tc-HV8tkA.text: Can't understand the outstanding reviews here. The Savoy may have been wonderful in the past; I remember coming here for fantastic meals years ago, but those glory days are long gone and the Savoy continues to trade on its previous good reputation. I don't think the celebrity chef has added anything but his name. The service was disappointing. We were the second of two couples to arrive and we were hardly acknowledged. Staff at the door chatted with one another and we had to interrupt their discourse to ask for menus and for our coats to be taken away.From the menu I chose the smoked salmon and then the beef, both of which were tasteless and lacklustre.  I won't be back.

7jWZv2MZa1Ve17gtL0tvcA.text: Hopeless restaurant, not recommended. The chief must be sleeping. The steak tasted terrible, the fish flavor was even worse.

FiZjhriz3gMa_opiqHqACg.text: I tend to avoid things associated with "celebrities" as I think they tend to be tourist traps but I'm happy that I chose The Savoy Grill for our anniversary dinner after hearing so many recommendations. The atmosphere is lovely, the staff is great and the food now makes me understand why Gordon Ramsay is a celebrity chef. What impressed me was that the waitstaff are actually good cooks and I know this because I ordered a Steak Diane and a Crepes Suzette which both have to be flambeed at the table. I was afraid the steak might turn out overcooked because of the flame but our waitress knew what she was doing and it was beautifully seared on the outside and medium rare on the inside (I hate it when someone turns a nice piece of steak into shoe leather) and it melted in my mouth. It was a good cut of meat but the credit belongs to her for cooking it perfectly. And a waiter prepared the crepes suzette at the table and it, too, was wonderful. I was actually sorry I waited until the end of the week or I would have eaten there again before returning to Manhattan. But I am glad I chose it for our anniversary because it was a great meal served in beautiful surroundings by professional and friendly people.

ni2uYM3NClCx6UgzCIkpVA.text: Last visit here was a few months ago, however, it was such a pleasant experience I had to drop a few words here.A friend and I dined from the special set menu, which was very prescriptive but oh so amazing. The 3 courses were sublime, starting with scallops, main was lamb with seasonal vegetables and desert was a fruit flambé with fresh vanilla ice cream. Although the menu sounds simple, it was executed to perfection.Service was great and all staff were friendly and knowledgeable.Definitely recommend a visit

3IGQhNz-9vDSN8IpvtIXBA.text: This place most definitely lived up to the hype. As Ramsay is one of my favorite social media personalities, I had to go ahead and try his flagship restaurant in London and I was not disappointed. Unlike many other fancy restaurants, Savoy does offer an exclusively vegetarian menu with several options which made things really easy.They start off everyone with bread and butter and the quality is quite high. I prefer the white bread over the whole wheat bread in terms of taste and found it a bit too hard to eat the crust of the bread.For the appetizer, I shared the Glazed Omelette with Comte and it was the best omelet I've ever had. Typically, when there is cheese in an omelet, it can be overwhelming, but in this dish, it was extremely subtle and rich enough, but not too creamy. I tried to eat it as slowly as possible because I wanted to savor and remember every bite. Usually, I need pepper and ketchup to make an omelet taste good, but this one is so so good on its own - just the right amount of flavor. For the main course, I had the mushroom and burrata vol-au-vent (had to look it up) and was very impressed. I was already pretty full and satisfied with the omelet and bread, but still enjoyed and wanted to eat all of this dish. The mushrooms are made very well - extremely juicy and full of flavor. The outside puff pastry is the flakiest I have ever seen for a puff - extremely crispy and not too buttery or sweet. The burrata could've been a little bit stronger but does blend well with the mushrooms and the cep ketchup. We didn't order dessert but they did bring us tiny macaroons which were absolutely heavenly. The inside chocolate was thick, creamy, and not too sweet. The service was very nice, helpful and quick and all the food ended up coming at a reasonable price. I will definitely need to come here again next time I'm in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Macaroons
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom and Burrata Vol-au-Vent
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Bread and Butter

TlMyfSydmv4wKmjbDFg25w.text: A Gordon Ramsey restaurant and fantastic ! One of the best restaurants in London .the savoy hotel is just magnificent.  Walk though the ornate lobby to the restaurant where you'll be treated like a queen .I had 3 male servers that took care of me .. all were in white jackets and ties and all were super attentive .They have a full vegan menu and an amazing wine selection . Superb !!

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. vegan menu  I'm in heaven

axmG2b1kYnrpIHs42N4V7w.text: One of London's fine dining experience restaurants.  The sort of place where they dextrously and unobtrusively whisk away all your silverware after each course, whether you used each piece or not, to replace it with a whole new set for the next course.I liked coming here because they have a pre- or post-theatre menu of 3 courses, none tremendously large, so perfect if you don't want to stuff yourself.  For each course there are a few choices.  I had a smooth and tasty onion soup, a Cumberland sausage (long and thin, it came rolled up on the plate), and a delicious creme caramel for dessert.

rVbIv7yzbNClAl8KRy5d4A.text: This is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. And as someone who watches all his shows, it was a must when in London. I started with the haddock, cod, and salmon fish cake. It was on a bed of pea and lovage, and topped with whipped cod's roe. Really perfect appetizer. (What is lovage, though??)My entree was a play on Shepherd's Pie -- a beef cottage pie with a cheddar mash. So much flavor and depth. Literally. It was a deep dish. I also tried the grilled park rib-eye with apple ketchup and a side of buttered leeks. Not better than the pie but well worth it. These dishes were a part of a special menu in partnership with the Savoy Theatre which is a 10 second walk from the restaurant. This special menu is deliciously affordable. It also comes with a glass of bubbly. Water is not free. It's poured from an unmarked bottle. Because we ended up paying for it, I'm glad I drank several glasses.And lastly, service was NICE. My phone was dead from using it all day sightseeing and yelping, and our server offered to charge it for me at the host stand. And dinner was paced perfectly so we could get to the theatre on time. Really great pre-show experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom

AWeTXQQzZGI8kZznybRSnw.text: Overall pretty disappointed in my food. I was super excited to dine at one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurant so I had pretty high expectations for the food. In particular, the infamous beef wellington...But dang, the beef wellington was soooo SALTY!! Like, spoiled in so much salt!!!? It was seriously inedible. Very annoyed to waste £88. Even my fiance loves salty food but this was WAY TOO SALTY. We spoke with the manager who claimed it was cooked as normal and no one else has complained... very, very disappointing. So, over half of the dish was left to toss. The manager offered us dessert on the house, but because we were one of the last ones dining, I'm sure they just gave us whatever leftovers they had. The food overall was very heavy and did not have any finesse. We made the mistake of booking two reservations here as guests of the Savoy, and a lot of restaurants were closed on Christmas day. We were hoping they would redeem themselves, but nope. Just average food. We couldn't cancel our reservations or they would charge our credit card on file.I really wish I could like the food here, but it was so boring as well. We were here twice in one week and dessert had the same ingredients (ie lemon and raspberry pastries). On Christmas day, we had dry turkey. Yuck.In the end, wasted TOO much money. Horrible place to eat. Save your money!

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Wellington. Super disappointing, way too salty, didn't even eat half of it. Womp womp

JtKZtGLRb6AhepQsJVQsyA.text: Beautiful restaurant brimming with history. I booked it for a large group work dinner without fully appreciating the lienage of the hotel or the restaurant.We were seated in a beatiful, private room that was great for an intimate group gathering. The set menu, while relatively simple, had some good starters and protein options. Starters included butternut squash soup and salmon tartare.Steak is a good default here and the tender, juicy tenderloid did not disappoint. And there were decadent desserts to top it all off: sticky toffee pudding, dark chocolate mousse with polenta shortbread, and marinated pineapple carpaccio with chili, lime, and mango (what!).Everything else, from service to wines, was also tip top. Overall, a very good value for the ambiance and group experience.

JXLBHLNf5ZO_oaycFRgsKQ.text: A beautiful restaurant in a gorgeous hotel! Gordon Ramsay never disappoints. To start we shared the steak tar tar appetizer and it was delicious. It did not give that raw texture like some do. It was a seasoned beautifully and the meat was top grade. If I could only say one thing it would be, get the Beef Wellington! The meat was cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth. If I ever find myself back in London I will be returning to Savoy for another great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Beef Wellington With Horseradish Cream And Red Wine

P6jKtOwUfNtQ-1DPObh5Rw.text: Great experience for lunch today! Service was impeccable, as you would expect from a restaurant like this, and food was outstanding. We came for the Wednesday lunch trolley special of beef Wellington. (It's been on my bucket list since our first trip to London). It was delicious. A perfectly cooked piece of meat with potatoes and cabbage. The mashed potatoes were so creamy and delicious. It was a lot of food, at one point I didn't think I'd finish my beef Wellington but it was so good I couldn't stop eating it. I'm really glad I came and if you're interested in trying their beef Wellington the Wednesday trolley special is the way to go. It was pretty busy so I'd suggested making a reservation. Total cost for two trolley specials, a glass of wine and an espresso martini £110.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Wednesday trolley special - came with two different potatoes and a vegetable. All delicious
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Wednesday trolley special - beef Wellington

P8MeRslDMsub7wvOCSdhfQ.text: Very disappointed in my experience.I came with the mindset that this was one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants (my first one) and that I would finally be able to taste fine dining as it is meant to be had.  I was wrong.I had the prix fixe menu and though the staff was very attentive and accommodating with any dietary sensitives one may have, that is where the excellent service stopped.  Moreover it took large swaths of time for the food to arrive.  The stars: delicious celery soup, wonderful Alexander omelet, light and satisfying Crêpes Suzette with a table-side flambé.Everything else was a flop.  My Beef Wellington's duxelles was too moist, so much so it made the puff pastry slightly soggy.  Several of my party ordered steaks and they came out very much under.  Everyone walked away confused and feeling a little betrayed by our experience since we expected so much from a Gordon Ramsay establishment.

gnqPvx5Sd_4yj7O1NSjeoQ.text: I came here for a business event where a reception and dinner were held in a private room.We started our evening with a selection of beverages and passed hors d'oeuvres. The options presented were delicious and the staff did a good job of ensuring everyone was taken care of.Our dinner was a sit down affair where we were presented with options from a pre-selected menu.  I opted for the lobster bisque, a sirloin steak and mille-feuille for dessert.  While the lobster bisque was creamy and rich with pieces of lobster and a slight aroma of brandy.  The steak came with a stack of fried potatoes, which I thought were the best part of the meal.  They were crisp on the outside, fluffy and tender on the inside and were perfectly cooked.  It took much willpower not to eat them all!  The steak, on the other hand, was less than desirable.  While the preparation was fine, the quality of the meat did not seem up to par, especially given the reputation of the Savoy Grill. I found the steak chewy, tough and somewhat bland.  I realize that it's not easy to cook for a big group, especially one where the majority of the guests order the same thing.  The service was great throughout the evening.  The staff worked hard to ensure our dinner was a success!The hotel is beautiful and I would like to return one day to enjoy a meal in the restaurant proper.

O3D_hA4uY_Bs6g1QtXeOQQ.text: We knew going in that this was going to be something special, it's chef Ramsey's flagship, so it was an ideal choice for our big, romantic, honeymoon dinner. You'd have to have never seen a single episode of Hell's Kitchen to be unaware that the beef Wellington is a staple, and having seen more than a few, our appetites and curiosities had been whetted. Everything here is through the roof. The wine list is a year long and, a few months in,  I just pointed at one, and they brought it. The service is beyond anything we're used to, and from the constant attention to our wine levels, it was clear that they wanted us to buy a second bottle. Intro bread, amuse bouche, apps: all fantastic, but we were eyeing the prize!It was everything we hoped, yet not quite what we expected. On the show, they are individual, but ours came as slices from a Wellington of much larger girth. Nonetheless, it was amazing, as were the sides, and the 900 extra desserts they JUST KEPT BRINGING once they discovered it was our honeymoon!!!Worth. Every. Single. Penny.

mRwQCzW1hOhA54qLJlkrLQ.text: A wonderful experience into my first dive into fine dining. The beef wellington was spectacular, but I wanted nothing to do with foie gras. I'm sure it was very well done, but I guess I just hate foie gras in general. The dessert was okay. The service was excellent, but maybe it's because I'm an American, but I couldn't really understand a lot of what my server was saying, and I felt weird about asking him to constantly repeat himself. I ended up saying "yes" to somethings I had no idea about, but everything ended up just fine. The price was out of control, but I knew I was coming here, so I prepared for it. I'm not sure that I would come back, but I don't regret the first experience.

8V4lLit56IW_LpKKLPX9rA.text: Our visit to the Savoy Grill was supposed to be the food highlight of our trip to London, but it turned out to be quite the opposite.We arrived right on time for our reservation and were told that our table wasn't ready and that it would be a while so we should go to the American Bar in the Savoy Hotel and have a drink. We're usually fine with a little pre-dinner drink (and don't get me wrong, the American Bar had INCREDIBLE cocktails), but it was a very pricey mistake on the Savoy's part, as we were left killing time in the American Bar drinking £25 cocktails that we didn't plan on, nor did we need. We've been to many upscale restaurants and whenever we've been left waiting by that, cocktails are compliments of the house as an apology gesture - PERIOD.So, £50+ and 2 cocktails later our table was ready. We were seated and immediately offered champagne by waiter #1 from the champagne cart, and since we had just killed time with cocktails we were pretty hungry and wanted to just get right down to ordering our meal - no frills, no extras. We came for the beef wellington, and that's what we wanted - not to mention after seeing the pricetag on the cocktails at American Bar we were a bit leery of ordering champagne from a cart with no price tag on it. It very well could have been £50 a glass the way things were going, and we didn't want or need it.Waiter #2 comes and offers us water, which we accept, and then she says something about a 9 course meal which we had signed up for (which we hadn't) and walks away before we could question it. Were we really getting forced into 9 courses at this point? I was honestly so confused and then had remembered it came up as an "offer" when booking on OpenTable. To be clear, I had not accepted this offer nor was it stated anywhere on my reservation, so we figured we'd just catch her when she came back around and tell her what we'd ACTUALLY like to order.Waiter #2 walked by several times but passively ignored us probably about 5 times, when waiter #3 came and took our order. We ordered beef wellington, as planned, as well as a side of truffle mashed potatoes.While seemingly inputting our order on the computer about 5 feet away from our table, waiter #2 is lurking behind waiter #3 scolding him for taking our order - because of course, we WANTED the 9 course special (wrong). She investigates the 9 course debacle and seems frustrated when she seems to find no record of it, as we tried to tell her (if only she had given us the time of day). She gives us a dirty look and proceeds to ignore us for most of the remainder of the evening.During the 45 minute waiting period for our beef wellington, not a single person stopped to ask if we needed anything, despite multiple tries to get their attention to bring more water to the table. We finally got the attention of waiter #4, who we hadn't seen before but seemed to work there and made eye contact with me so I asked. He accepted to bring us more water, but then never came back.Let me preface my review of our actual food by saying I've watched most of Chef Ramsay's shows and seen him cook beef wellington on TV many times. I had visions of grandeur - perfectly cooked, delicious, melt in your mouth goodness. Our actual meal was not a vision at all, in fact. It was bland, uninspired, and just not cooked to perfection at all. The meat was fine - not good, not bad. There wasn't enough puff pastry. The sauce they put on the meat tasted like store-bought au jus from a packet. And the truffle mashed potatoes were not only small, but they were essentially just mashed potatoes with a couple of tiny truffles sprinkled on top.While our entree was disappointing, we saw our neighboring table order a baked alaska and it looked good so we decided to order, and honestly it was the highlight of the meal. Without that, between the tardiness of our table, atrocious service (It's still absolutely appalling to me that we were passed off to FOUR different waiters and not one was even the slightest bit personable), and lackluster food, I wouldn't have had a single star to give the Savoy.Next time I'm in London, I will definitely go elsewhere - somewhere that values service more and doesn't discriminate against those who don't want a ton of extras with their meal. Sorry Savoy, not everyone needs a 9 course feast.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Very sad side of truffle mashed potatoes
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef wellington - pro tip: order without the sauce which tastes like store-bought au jus in a packet.

vLP7jZNKX93ATtRHsCK_Qw.text: Absolutely had to try Ramsey's Beef Wellington. It was everything I expected it to be and more! The service was wonderful. We took our pre-teens grandchildren on recent trip to London for nice fine dining experience...their parents idea of fine dining is Olive Garden...The kids loved it and are now spoiled. They tried the Foie Gras, and the Caviar. We had Beef Wellington with creamed spinach and roast field mushrooms. Crepes Suzette fro dessert....Everything was unforgettable.

Px7mCksKm6BunXdFOJRXBQ.text: We started with the lobster bisque with brandy butter. That was yummy! The beef Wellington here was better quality meat than the Hereford beef we had at other London restaurants like Dinner by Heston. I'm still dreaming about it and regret the 2 bites I left on the plate as my stomach was getting so full and had to leave room for dessert. For dessert I had crepes suzzette and my partner had the blueberry mille fueille,  they also gave us two little vanilla cakes with our after dinner coffee. Were huge Gordon Ramsey fans and just wish they'd had sticky toffee pudding on the menu though.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. hazelnut macarons
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla cakes...
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Raspberry mille-fueille

htr3-pR9N3EtMvOKlHEkJw.text: This was absolutely my favorite meal while we were in London. The passion fruit martini was both pretty and tasty.We started with the steak tartare, which was really good, but we came for the beef wellington, which surpassed our expectations by far and we will definitely come back for it again the next time we're in town. We ordered the cream spinach and truffle mash as sides, which were good, but not necessary considering the star of the show was the beef wellington.We were full, but finished off our meal with the mille feuille and were not disappointed. The service was excellent and the hotel is beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Vanilla, raspberry, and lemon mille feuille.
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Passion fruit martini.
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Beef Beef Wellington With Horseradish Cream And Red Wine

mu-N840HMsz8j5QxC85cbw.text: The best part of the Savoy Grill is the atmosphere. It seriously feels like you walk into the gilded age of the 1920s. Apart from the atmosphere, the food leans french / English and in my opinion is only slightly above average. I had the frau Grois patè to start, decent, tattinger champagne good but 38 gbp is expensive, and the beef Wellington, and a crepe for desert. Across the board the food was prepared excellently but the flavor was either bland- the Wellington, over overpowering the crepe. The Wellington for 2 was 82 gbp and I would probably never order again. It was bland, however the red wine au jus was fantastic. All in all, a dining experience of two extremes.

PTi1Nku2gnscYw-Hjdq9UQ.text: Finally, good food in Britain. I was losing hope and my taste buds were starting to die off one by one until Savoy resurrected them back to life. Yep, they are still working, taste buds that is. The Grille is an Art Deco 1920's-30's theme. I could imagine Churchill or Coco Chanel whisking around the corner. It's gorgeous in an old British way. We ordered Escoffier's tasting menu. Yes, THAT Escoffier, the famous gentlemen in the culinary world with that iconic instructional cookbook manual. He may have been a crook but he could cook. The Bombe can be lit on fire two different ways, directly or in a pot and poured on. Either way, the spectacle and drama of culinary is still alive here at Savoy Grille. The crepes are freshly prepared at your table too. Gratuity is included with the tasting menu so sit back, order, and let the entertainment begin.Amazing service - but allow 3 hours for dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Savoy Menu
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Ravioli
Photo of Savoy Grill - London, United Kingdom. Eggs

nhuSFf__dmXuYkKm8wNkKw.text: After a leisurely morning with my paper and a coffee (and some fine tobacco), I walked the streets of London to admire its architecture, history and people.  By midday I was hungry and so it only made sense to me that I visit this tried and true restaurant conveniently located to my hotel's lobby.  I was not disappointed.  The beef paired well with a lesser known bottle from Saint-Émilion.

8AOZn4l-IdW3gUGa1Avsgw.text: Had to try it. Great food and even better service. I very much enjoyed my steak and potatoes. The apple tart will live in my memory forever! I will warn you; however, that it is Not the place for you if you don't feel comfortable with the fine dinning experience.
